intro: Cysticapnos parviflora, commonly known as the dwarf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly woolly texture. Cysticapnos parviflora is also known for its milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of many plants in its family.
